Expense.name: Expense
Expense.description: Represents an expense linked to a work order. Service resource technicians can log expenses, such as tools or travel costs.

AccountId.description: The ID of the account associated with the linked work order.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only if the multicurrency feature is enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

Discount.description: The percentage deducted from the Subtotal price. Available in version 51.0 and later.

ExpenseEndDate.description: If the expense was incurred over multiple days, the Expense End Date is the last day that the expense covers.

ExpenseNumber.description: The number that uniquely identifies the expense.

ExpenseStartDate.description: If the expense was incurred over multiple days, the Expense Start Date is the first day that the expense covers.

ExpenseType.description: The type of expense. Possible values are: Billable Non-Billable The default value is Billable.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the user who owns the expense record.

Quantity.description: The number of items purchased in this record. Available in version 51.0 and later.

Subtotal.description: The subtotal price calculated as the product of Quantity and UnitPrice. Available in version 51.0 and later.

Title.description: A title that identifies the expense.

TotalPrice.description: The total price of the transaction which is equal to the discounted subtotal: Subtotal - (Discount * Subtotal). Available in version 51.0 and later.

TransactionDate.description: The day that the expense was incurred, or the payment date for the expense.

UnitPrice.description: The price of one item on the record. Available in version 51.0 and later.

WorkOrderId.description: The ID of the work order associated with the expense.
